review:
It's... fine? I've completed Normal mode with great frustration and will not be going for the Hard Mode achievements or whatever the hidden achievements may be. It feels more like an extended demo than a real game due to the awkward movement mechanics (double tapping left or right sometimes glitches and sends you flying in one direction to your doom) and awful enemy AI. Enemies will more often than not just run toward you and fall to the depths below. I *would* say to their doom, but they don't die. They just fall down however many sections until they stop (sometimes into lava that will damage you but won't kill them).

Probably this game's greatest sin is the complete lack of invincibility frames after being damaged. It can be annoying when facing regular enemies, but against most bosses it is an absolute nightmare. 

If you see it on sale for $1 and you *REALLY* want to give it a shot... sure, go for it. But it's not worth the asking price of $2.99. Like I said, it feels more like an extended demo than anything else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128239804', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1614722818}
review:
Blasting Agent: Ultimate Edition es un juego de acción y plataformas, con estilo retro, que a pesar de contar con una base interesante, pronto hará que te des cuenta que no cubrirá tus expectativas.
El aspecto gráfico es llamativo, con un estilo pixelado y un diseño trabajado. Sin duda, el mejor apartado del juego y el único digno de mención, a pesar de algún punto negativo como el no saber diferenciar, en ocasiones, si delante tenemos un decorado de fondo o una pared que nos impide el paso.
La banda sonora es aceptable, y simplemente cumple sin molestar.
La jugabilidad es realmente pobre. Los movimientos son nefastos y no responderán ni de lejos a lo que realmente queremos hacer (en este sentido, el Dash es un suplicio por activarse cuando uno menos lo necesita). Los niveles, seis en total, no tienen un mal diseño, pero su dificultad no demasiado elevada contrasta con la dificultad de alguno de sus bosses. La durabilidad, de unas 15 horas, es aceptable.
Especialmente negativo es el hecho de, una vez superado el juego en modo Normal, intentar superarlo en modo Hard. En el segundo nivel, si escoges a la Ninja para tener alguna posibilidad de vencer al enemigo final, el juego crashea durante ese combate y deberás empezar de nuevo el nivel, impidiéndote avanzar por mucho que lo intentes (mucha gente reporta este error pero los desarrolladores no han hecho nada para solventarlo).
En definitiva, un juego aceptable en algún punto, pero en general bastante pobre y con errores que te impedirán disfrutarlo por completo. Me es imposible recomendarlo.

Nota: 5,5/10

review:
Воистину иллюстрация к надписи "как нынешние горе-игроделы считают, выглядели старые игры". Разрешение меньше чем на геймбое.

На дефолте игра ужасающе проста, за смерть нифига не наказывают и отбрасывают в начало КОМНАТЫ (не уровня) с полностью восстановленным здоровьем. author: {'steamid': '76561198188065497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1523139466}
review:
This game is awesome IMO. I consider it to be one of the better games on Steam that (unfortunately for the devs) hasn't got the attention it deserves.

First off, let me say that another reviewer mentioned "I like indie game, I feel that smaller developers tend to focus on gameplay over showy superficial junk" and I wholeheartedly agree with this. I am so tired of seeing games where clearly the bulk of the focus went into the presentation. 

Blasting Agent is an excellent metroidvania style game. Although I suppose you could just move through levels as quickly as possible the way to really maximize the value of this game IMO is to just take your time and explore each level. Blasting Agent makes it easy to immerse yourself in the game and rewards you for doing so.

Everything is very high quality. The ultra low res graphics have a very unique look to them which makes the game stand out in a good way from most of the games on Steam. The game probably most resembles something like Environmental Station Alpha. The gameplay is very good with some nice areas to explore and power ups to find. The enemies are varied and the bosses (I've only fought one so far) are interesting as well.

I haven't encountered any issues with the controls or with crashing as some have mentioned so perhaps this is something that was fixed at some point.

SUMMARY: The whole game is very well done. This game is easily worth $7 to $8 and is a complete steal at the ridiculously low $3 price it is currently selling for.  If you like this kind of game take the plunge and buy Blasting Agent. It is a great game.

This is a fun little game.  I enjoyed it on both the Wii U and 3DS.  

On a side note: It is funny because some of the things that annoyed me on the Wii U and 3DS versions, were either fixed or not an issue on the Steam version, but the controls and playing tactics are so off that it ruined the game for me on the Steam version.  Maybe if I played the Steam version first, I would have a different opinion, who knows.

review:
Apenas he jugado, pero me ha sobrado tiempo para aburrirme.

Hasta donde he podido ver, el juego consiste en avanzar por distintos niveles y al final aparece un boss, todo normal por ahora.

No tiene historia. Pulsas el botón 'Start', sale un mapa, eliges nivel y a jugar; te explican a base de carteles lo poco que es el juego y listo.
Hay un contador de porcentaje tanto de enemigos que hemos matado como de dinero recogido durante el nivel, pero no parece servir de nada más allá de decir "oye mira, tengo el 100%".
Podemos recoger 3 tipos de power-ups que son permanentes.
Y como movimientos tenemos: desplazamiento normal, disparo y salto... Ah! Y un "dash" que esta glitcheado, el cual nos dará un impulso continuo exagerado si realizamos el movimiento mientras disparamos (la manera de pararlo es dejar de disparar); eso si consigues hacerlo, porque no te explican cómo se realiza dicho movimiento.
El diseño de niveles... Pues no es gran cosa.
Los gráficos, los que se pueden ver en las imágenes.
La música es quizás de lo poco que se salva sin llegar a ser ningún bombazo.
Como cosa curiosa que añadir, el juego se muestra en una ventanita a resolución 4:3 aunque lo tengamos a pantalla completa y añade un fondo de bloques a izquierda y derecha (podéis ver más claro a qué me refiero en los vídeos).

Me lo he comprado en las rebajas de verano 2017, a 1'01€ y personalmente, creo que no los vale, mucho menos sin descuento (2'99€).
No esperaba un triple A, simplemente algo entretenido, y definitivamente Blasting Agent no me lo ha parecido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071206305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1498702853}
review:
There is the foundation of a good game here, but its problems overpower its potential.

I quite enjoy the pixel art style (even though gaudy background elements can sometimes make it hard to tell what is and isn't a platform) and while the chip tunes aren't stellar, they're at least passable. When they work, the controls are tight and feel good. Finding permanent weapon and life upgrades encourages exploration, as does unlocking perks when you find all the gold and kill all the enemies in a level. The bosses are pretty cool, too.

Having said that, the game has crashed repeatedly on me; sometimes on startup, sometimes after finishing a level and sometimes right in the middle of the action. Also, Sometimes the controls just go absolutely nuts. My character will autonomously decide to start an uninteruptable air-dash, sucking him off the screen and to his death regardless of what I'm actually pressing on the controller. Oh, and the achievements don't work at all, either.

The crashes and unreliable controls reduce what would have been a reasonably fun game into an exercise in annoyance. If these issues are addressed in a patch it might become worth playing.

review:
Que jogo, meus amigos. Que jogo!
Blasting Agent é um jogo Nes-like, Plataforma 2D, com dificuldade acentuada e uma trilha sonora MATADORA, sério, compensa comprar ela para ouvir depois, muito boa mesmo, o jogo tem uma referência clara aos Duke nukem clássicos(2D).
O único problema que tive com o jogo é que ele fechou algumas vezes enquanto eu jogava, e da uma frustração ter de jogar o nivel todo novamente, mas tirando isso é um BAITA JOGO e vale demais a compra. Uma dica que dou: se uma fase ou boss estiver IMPOSSÍVEL, volte na fase anterior ou na mesma fase e confira se pegou todos os power-ups, pode estar faltando algum.
Vi algumas pessoas reclamando do "lock-on" do jogo, mas é uma coisa necessária para alguns momentos mais difíceis do jogo e para alguns boss também. Seguinte, quando vc pressiona o botão de tiro, o personagem fica mirando apenas para aquele lado, travando a mira para onde está apontado, sendo que enquanto tiver pressionado, você vai mirar apenas assim, correndo e pulando estará fixado para aquele lado. Mas isso é uma coisa excelente, basta se acostumar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051833438', 'num_games_owned': 6279, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1483406053}
review:
Oh man, I really wanted to love this game. I bought it during the winter sale and had it on my "to buy" list since the start.

Unfortunately I was disappointed in the game, if there are some major changed done to it in the future I may think of buying it again. But as it is now, I won't be playing this game.

The things that I liked and made me what to buy Blasting Agent:
[list]
[*]Screenshots looked nice, made me think of Duke (Before he went 3D)
[*]The Game looks like  it has rich challenging, and fun environment
[*]I like indie game, I feel that smaller developers tend to focus on gameplay over showy superficial junk
[/list]
The things that made me lose interest in the game:
[list]
[*]Fixed jumps, and unfriendly controls for platforming for instance you cannot change direction while holding down the shoot button, commands have to be fed to the game independently otherwise it will not register them
[*]Poorer visuals in reality than I got from screenshots
[*]Some glitches, like tearing in the bg with every jump, and what I think is a glitch as my little dude slides around rather than walking, he is not animated in any way besides moving from one location to another, he doesn't walk and that creates a bit too much disconnect for me, he might as well be a curling stone
[*]The soundtrack is a little grating
[*]The game made me think of Duke in the screenshots but had nothing resembling it when I actually played it (yes, that's my own problem, but it was still a factor for me personally)
[*]Forced difficulty barriers and somewhat of a fake challenge brought on by enemy behaviour and being outgunned by even my very first foe
[*]Limited options menu (although it does allow for changing key binding and other basic things)
[/list]

All together, the game has potential, it drew me in and made me want to buy it, it still has interesting levels and variety, but as it is right now, it's rather unfriendly to me as a player, and a visual bug that occurs with every jump in a platformer is a little too much to ignore.

[h1]Final Score: 6/10[/h1]
[b]Has potential but I do not recommend it in its current state[/b]
developer_response:
I apologize for your issues with the game!

I'd like to address two of your issues:

1: The strafe-shooting is a deliberate mechanic. Holding down the shoot button as you move 'locks' the direction you're facing. Mastering this mechanic is almost required to beat some of the tougher bosses.

2: The tile-tearing issue is apparently a new issue introduced in the recent update for some people. It is definitely a problem, and I'm working on a fix right now. As for the player 'sliding', this was another recently introduced bug, but a fix was deployed as soon as it was discovered.

We will have an update out as soon as a solution is found for the tile-tearing issue. 

As for your other issues, I believe they are more of a personal preference thing with the way the game was designed, and there's not much I can do about that - although I'm sure having the problems mentioned above didn't help ingratiate the game to you.

review:
I played it for about an hour so far. It's quite fun for the price. I have completed two levels and got about halfway through a third before I had to quit. You have to start the whole level over if you quit. I can not tell how many levels there are.

It's exactly what you see in the video; jump around, explore and shoot things. You find power-ups (range, spread and damage) that are permanent, as well as hearts to extend your HP, and piles of, um, gold? that I haven't found a use for yet.

You have infinite lives, and each door is apparently a checkpoint. When you die, all enemies respawn and you lose all progress since going through the last doorway. This is usually not much of a lose, but annoying enough to not want it to happen.

The first boss was easy. The second was a pain.

I don't have a lot negative to say other than the enemy AI seems a little dumb at times. You can stand at just the right distance and shoot some of them while they ignore you, or they keep shooting at you without moving when they don't have the range to hit you. They will jump up or down ledges to get to you, though.

The gamepad config didn't seem to work right for me. No matter what button I hit to assign to an action, it puts "Guide" as the button I pressed. Luckily, the defaults were ok with me (A = jump, B = fire).

Oh yeah, and the ninja guys suck.

Edit: 

I hadn't even noticed when I first wrote this review that you can also bounce on the enemies heads to kill them.

I finished it in a little over 3 hours. The level 4 boss was stupidly hard. Do yourself a favor and [spoiler] make sure you have at least 3 damage upgrades [/spoiler] before fighting him.

The final boss was the easiest boss but it may be because [spoiler] I had 6 damage upgrades. [/spoiler]

There are 6 levels. Beating it unlocked a hard mode.
